line_1: Parrots themselves speak properly by rote,
line_2: And, in six months, my dog shall howl by note.

line_1: Like A, B, C, they're learnt by rote;
line_2: As a long Wig, or powder'd Coat:

line_1: And rant all Lucian's rhapsodies by rote.
line_2: Full of the Roman let the school-boy quote,

line_1: And told the soothing ditty all by rote,
line_2: The linnet here did ope his little throat,

line_1: And told the soothing ditty all by rote,
line_2: And the proud goldsinch show'd his painted coat,

line_1: And told the soothing ditty all by rote,
line_2: And hail'd us with no inharmonious note:

line_1: Took not the common way, and kill'd by Rote;
line_2: He weigh'd each C rcumstance e'er gave his Vote,

line_1: And got the Lover's Cant by rote:
line_2: He purchas'd all the Songs of Note,

line_1: Could sing one hundred Hymns by rote;
line_2: Hymns which will sanctify the throte:
